intro: Aporosa lucida var. trilocularis, commonly known as the glossy aporosa, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded forest understories. The fruit is a three-lobed capsule that splits open to release its seeds.
